001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004import java.util.Arrays;
005
006import org.immutables.value.Value;
007
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
009
010import io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation.BiFunction;
011import io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler;
012
013/**
014 * A resampled distribution formed by combining samples from two distributions
015 * using a binary combiner function.
016 *
017 * <p>
018 * This interface defines a distribution that draws PRECISION samples by
019 * repeatedly sampling two component distributions and applying the configured
020 * {@link BiFunction} combiner. It is useful when a derived distribution is
021 * constructed by combining two stochastic sources such as when modelling the
022 * sum, difference or other combination of two uncertain quantities.
023 * </p>
024 *
025 * <p>
026 * Downstream uses: the resulting resampled data is consumed by empirical or
027 * interpolated distribution routines such as {@link EmpiricalDistribution} and
028 * by risk or behaviour modelling code that requires a sample-based
029 * representation. See also {@link io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.StateUtils}
030 * for places where sampled distributions are used in state transformations.
031 * </p>
032 *
033 * @author Rob Challen
034 */
035@Value.Immutable
036public interface ResampledDistribution extends Distribution, Serializable {
037
038        /**
039         * Number of samples used to represent the resampled distribution.
040         */
041        int PRECISION = 10000;
042        // int KNOTS = 50;
043
044        /**
045         * The binary combiner applied to pairs of samples from the two component
046         * distributions.
047         *
048         * @return the combiner function
049         */
050        BiFunction<Double, Double, Double> getCombiner();
051
052        /**
053         * Empirical cumulative distribution function computed from the resampled
054         * values. The implementation counts values strictly less than x and applies
055         * the usual (rank + 1)/(N + 1) correction used for empirical CDFs.
056         *
057         * @param x threshold at which to evaluate the cumulative probability
058         * @return the empirical cumulative probability P(X &lt; x)
059         */
060        default double getCumulative(double x) {
061                return ((double) Arrays.stream(this.getSamples()).filter(d -> d < x)
062                                .count() + 1) / (PRECISION + 1);
063        }
064
065        /**
066         * The first component distribution used to generate samples.
067         *
068         * @return the first distribution
069         */
070        Distribution getFirst();
071
072        /**
073         * Returns an empirical interpolation of the resampled distribution.
074         *
075         * <p>
076         * This builds an {@link EmpiricalDistribution} from the link function and
077         * the resampled values. The interpolation may be more efficient for repeated
078         * queries such as quantile lookups.
079         * </p>
080         *
081         * @return an interpolated empirical distribution derived from the samples
082         */
083        @Value.Lazy
084        default EmpiricalDistribution getInterpolation() {
085                return EmpiricalDistribution.fromData(this.getLink(), this.getSamples());
086        }
087
088        /**
089         * Returns the maximum support of the resampled distribution, estimated from
090         * the resampled values.
091         *
092         * @return the sample maximum
093         */
094        @Override @Value.Default @JsonIgnore
095        default double getMaxSupport() {
096                return Arrays.stream(this.getSamples()).min()
097                                .orElse(Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY);
098        }
099
100        /**
101         * The mean estimated from the resampled values.
102         *
103         * @return the sample mean
104         */
105        @Value.Derived
106        default double getMean() {
107                return Arrays.stream(this.getSamples()).average().getAsDouble();
108        }
109
110        /**
111         * The median estimated from the resampled values.
112         *
113         * @return the sample median
114         */
115        @Value.Derived
116        default double getMedian() {
117                var tmp = this.getSamples();
118                Arrays.sort(tmp);
119                return tmp[PRECISION / 2];
120        }
121
122        /**
123         * Returns the minimum support of the resampled distribution, estimated from
124         * the resampled values.
125         *
126         * @return the sample minimum
127         */
128        @Override @Value.Default @JsonIgnore
129        default double getMinSupport() {
130                return Arrays.stream(this.getSamples()).min()
131                                .orElse(Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY);
132        }
133
134        /**
135         * Generate PRECISION samples by repeatedly sampling the two component
136         * distributions and applying the combiner. This method performs sampling
137         * eagerly and may be moderately expensive; callers that require many
138         * repeated queries should use {@link #getInterpolation()} to build an
139         * empirical distribution for more efficient lookups.
140         *
141         * @return an array of PRECISION sampled values from the resampled
142         *         distribution
143         */
144        @Override @Value.Derived
145        default double[] getSamples() {
146                var out = new double[PRECISION];
147                for (var i = 0; i < PRECISION; i++) {
148                        out[i] = this.sample();
149                }
150                return out;
151        }
152
153        /**
154         * The second component distribution used to generate samples.
155         *
156         * @return the second distribution
157         */
158        Distribution getSecond();
159
160        /**
161         * Draw a single sample by sampling the two components and applying the
162         * combiner. This is the basic sampling operation used to generate the full
163         * resampled array.
164         *
165         * @param rng the random sampler to use
166         * @return a single sampled value
167         */
168        @Override
169        public default double sample(Sampler rng) {
170                return this.getCombiner()
171                                .apply(this.getFirst().sample(rng), this.getSecond().sample(rng));
172        }
173
174}
